modules.description: This module handles the creation and validation of X.509 certificate signing requests and certificates, and their encoding as DNS TLSA records. It provides functions to generate signing requests with subject names and alternative hostnames, encode them into TLSA records, and validate certificates against signing requests based on public key and hostname matches. It also supports DNS-based certificate discovery and management via functions to construct DNS update packets and query for TLSA records that contain certificates or CAs.

This module generates private keys and certificate signing requests, then securely submits them via DNS-TSIG to a configured server for signing. It works with domain names, DNS keys, IP addresses, and TLS certificates, supporting automated certificate retrieval during service startup. It is used in unikernels needing immediate TLS certificate availability, such as web or mail servers.

This module automates the generation of private keys and certificate signing requests, then securely submits them using DNS-TSIG to a designated server for signing. It handles domain names, DNS keys, IP addresses, and TLS certificates, enabling unikernels to obtain certificates at startup for services like web or mail servers.
